MPISD was proud to participate in the ribbon cutting ceremony for the Boys & Girls Clubs of the Big Pines today! Thank you to the Chamber and all of of the community members who helped us celebrate!

The Boys & Girls Club of the Big Pines provides after-school child care for MPISD students in Kindergarten-6th grade. It is housed at the Wallace Middle School campus, with students in K-4th grades being bussed in from their respective elementary campuses. The Boys & Girls Club provides a snack, help with homework, and fun activities after school, Monday-Friday until 6:00 p.m.

If you are interested in registering your student, go to www.BeGreatEastTexas.com or email Brooke at Brooke@BeGreatEastTexas.com with questions. Cost is as little as $4 per month for those who qualify!

Why do we have to continue doing online work or packets if school is "closed"?

We have gotten this question from many of you through our various social media sites, so this post is an attempt to clarify school being "closed".

The Governor has closed school BUILDINGS across the state of Texas. But the Texas Education Agency is requiring each school district to provide distance learning/school-at-home to finish the year. In order to certify that our students have met the requirements for 2019-2020, we must document that we've delivered instruction (online/packets) and that we have provided feedback to students (worked turned in).

MPISD will continue delivering instruction at www.mpisd.net, packet pick up on Mondays, and/or online platforms like Google Classroom, Blackboard, and Schoology to complete our 2019-2020 school year. We ask that you continue emailing completed work to teachers, turning it in online if that is the platform you're using, or dropping off completed packets on Mondays.

If you have any questions, please call your child's campus Monday-Friday from 9:00-3:00.

She said if I email or text her copies of homemade Easter cards or pictures, she can print them out and distribute them to the residents. (I am thinking that 1-sided pictures/cards would be best.)

So, I guess I am asking for help. If your children/grandchildren or even you would like to make one or more Easter pictures/cards, email them to me, and I will get them to the nursing home. I know it's a small thing, but it can be a blessing to those who need to know they haven't been forgotten.

Thank you in advance.....

The members of the National Elementary Honor Society (NEHS) at E.C. Brice Elementary School held a food drive this month to benefit E.C. Brice families. Nevills Chapel Missionary Baptist Church donated the food items, and E.C. Brice NEHS, along with Communities In Schools (CIS), sorted and distributed the food to benefit Brice families in need as part of a district-wide food drive.

“CIS looked at the needs of the E.C. Brice students and carefully selected 15 families that we thought would benefit from the food boxes the most,” said Brice CIS Coordinator, Sarah Flanagan. “These families will hopefully get to experience a Thanksgiving meal that they otherwise would not have gotten had they not received this donation. CIS is excited to be a part of future service projects with E.C. Brice NEHS.”

Brice NEHS Advisor Rachel Findley said, “It’s always good for our NEHS members to take part in giving and helping others. No matter how big or small your efforts are God’s going to bless it; the kids see that and reap the joy that comes from such selfless acts of kindness.”

Congratulations to Karla Coker and Shonda Rutledge of Wallace Middle School who were presented Above and Beyond awards at last night's Board meeting.

Around 5:00 p.m. on October 9th, a fire in Winfield was reported to MPISD Administrators. It was unknown if students of MPISD were affected. Upon hearing the news, Karla and Shonda immediately headed that direction. They knew several students lived in the area and might need assistance. In fact, several were impacted with the loss of a home by fire or displaced due to smoke damage. Karla and Shonda located the students, ensured they were safe, obtained clothing sizes, assessed other family needs, and confirmed they had a place to sleep. They also followed up on the students after the event. These two ladies work tirelessly every day to serve students at Wallace and willingly extend their services to students throughout our community.

Thank you Mrs. Coker and Mrs. Rutledge for all you do for the students in MPISD! 🖤💛

Hey MP! Do you play tennis? Come join us for a "Spooktacular" Community tennis tournament with a Halloween theme, sponsored by the MPHS tennis team! All MP community members are invited to participate! It will be held on Saturday, October 26, at the Mount Pleasant High School tennis courts, located near the Mount Pleasant Junior High campus.

Check in will be at 8:00 with matches starting at 8:30 Since this is a Halloween event please feel free to wear a costume! Tennis shoes are mandatory!

This is a singles and doubles tournament (2 out of 3 matches with a tiebreaker for the 3rd set.) Doubles tournament is "anything goes" so you can have an adult/adult, adult/junior, junior/junior, parent/junior.
This can even make for a fun date!!! We hope to see you here!

To register, go to https://www.myutr.com/events/13210

On Sept 19th the Wallace Middle School PE dept started a running club that meets every Thursday. Students run or walk around the track for 45 minutes. The first week saw 67 students attend but last week they had 93!

Last week, they ran 100 laps (combined) in honor of
Veteran James South. He is a WWII Veteran who is celebrating his 100th birthday on Oct 7th and when asked by his son what he wanted for his birthday, all he asked for was 100 birthday cards. The club decided to honor him by running on his behalf.

Wallace videoed the event and contacted the family and nursing home to give him the banner and a copy of the video. The family will present it all to him on his birthday.

Running club members are signed up to run in the “Everything Texas” at Priefert Ranch on Oct 19 and the Suzanna Grigsby event later in the month.

Way to go Wallace Running club! 🖤💛👟
